result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice P Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/21/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
- Successfully complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

**08-21-15/PRH**
Defendant is currently in absconder status and non-compliance with probation conditions. Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days in HOC; STRAIGHT TIME, with no good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice P Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice P Jackson not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant did not appear and is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Maurice P Jackson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No posession of control subtances without a valid prescription.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Victim Impact Statement and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 am.

Defendant Maurice P Jackson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for jury trial. Parties ready to proceed. Case passed.

Defendant Maurice P Jackson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/06/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Court modified no contact order to allow 3rd party contact.

Defendant Maurice P Jackson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice P Jackson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Maurice P Jackson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
